Notes: Education Minister Dr Dipu Moni said all schools and colleges in the country would reopen after Eid-ul-Fitr on May 23 in light of the recent surge in Covid-19 cases and deaths.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412182156/https://www.dhakatribune.com/bangladesh/education/2021/03/25/dipu-moni-schools-colleges-likely-to-reopen-after-eid

Residents are advised to work from home if possible. The Government of Bangladesh has implemented further measures to limit the spread of COVID-19, including extending the general holiday period to May 5.  Bangladesh government offices and private sector organizations will largely be closed until at least May 5, and the government has advised everyone to stay home during this period.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412182252/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
No public gatherings of any kind are allowed.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412182252/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

No public gatherings of any kind are allowed.  A maximum of five people is allowed for daily prayer at every mosque, and a maximum of 10 people are allowed for Friday prayer.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412182252/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Public transportation is suspended to include passenger trains. Is public transportation operating? No. The recent lockdown is from April 5 – April 11. Public transportation will not be available during this time.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412182252/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

The Government of Bangladesh announced a countrywide lockdown to limit the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic starting from April 5, 2021. The Government of Bangladesh has implemented further measures to limit the spread of COVID-19, including extending the general holiday period to May 5.  Bangladesh government offices and private sector organizations will largely be closed until at least May 5, and the government has advised everyone to stay home during this period. A daily curfew is in effect from 6 p.m. to 6 a.m.  Hospitals, pharmacies, and food stores remain open. Public transportation and banking services remain limited.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412182252/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Both shopper and trader need pass for shopping and will be monitored regularly. https://web.archive.org/web/20210426214220/https://www.dhakatribune.com/bangladesh/nation/2021/04/23/movement-pass-required-for-shopping

Is a curfew in place? Only from 6 p.m. to 6 a.m.  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? Yes.  Residents should remain in their homes from 6 p.m. to 6 a.m. except for emergencies or for essential needs, such as shopping for food and medicine.  Residents are advised to work from home if possible.  Public transportation is suspended to include passenger trains.  No travel is allowed from district to district.  Domestic flights are suspended.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412182252/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

If international travelers arrive in Bangladesh with COVID-19 symptoms, they will be institutionally quarantined for 14 days.  If international travelers arrive in Bangladesh with no COVID-19 symptoms, they will be required to “home quarantine” for 14 days.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412182252/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Temporary closure of land border with India for 14 days from 26 April onwards. https://web.archive.org/web/20210426214002/https://www.dhakatribune.com/bangladesh/2021/04/25/bangladesh-seals-border-with-india-to-check-covid-19-spread
No updates.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412182252/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
No new updates.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412182252/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
The government is providing regular updates.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412182252/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

PCR and/or antigen tests available and test results are available within 72 hours  The Government of Bangladesh has provided a list of recommended COVID-19 testing facilities for international passengers here. Those wishing to get tested will have to pay for their own COVID-19 test.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412182252/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
No new update in policy.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412182252/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

The Government of Bangladesh has made wearing masks and social distancing mandatory when outside the home. Public administrators in Khulna Division have instituted a fine of TK 4,000 for those not adhering to this order.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412182252/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

""Vaccination is now open for people above 40 years old which was initially 55 years""  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412184456/https://www.thedailystar.net/opinion/macro-mirror/news/impressive-start-covid-vaccination-bangladesh-2044789

No significant updates particular to the elderly people. However, please note: Is a curfew in place? Only from 6 p.m. to 6 a.m.  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? Yes.  Residents should remain in their homes from 6 p.m. to 6 a.m. except for emergencies or for essential needs, such as shopping for food and medicine.  Residents are advised to work from home if possible.  Public transportation is suspended to include passenger trains.  No travel is allowed from district to district.  Domestic flights are suspended.  International flights remain operational.  No indoor dining services are allowed.  Delivery food service options are available.  Grocery stores and pharmacies may remain open.  Residents can shop in bazaars only when necessary.  Shopping malls, gyms, sports complexes, and recreation centers are closed.  No public gatherings of any kind are allowed.  A maximum of five people is allowed for daily prayer at every mosque, and a maximum of 10 people are allowed for Friday prayer.  All tourist locations are closed.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412182252/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

No change.   Students across the country returned to school beginning February, especially students of Classes PP-VIII. Students of classes IX-XII will start returning to schools in April since classes X and XII had their board examinations in March.  It appears therefore that the actual return to school has been staggered by agegroup despite the formal announcements of the government.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210330085548/https://kuenselonline.com/students-excited-to-be-back-at-school/
No change from the March 27 PM Statement.    Press Release from PM Archived: http://web.archive.org/web/20210330091444/https://kuenselonline.com/press-release-from-prime-ministers-office/

Students across the country returned to school beginning February, especially students of Classes PP-VIII.  Students of classes IX-XII will start returning to schools in April since classes X and XII had their board examinations in March  http://web.archive.org/web/20210330085548/https://kuenselonline.com/students-excited-to-be-back-at-school/
All movie theatres, snooker rooms and video parlours should be closed.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210330091444/https://kuenselonline.com/press-release-from-prime-ministers-office/

No change from the March 27 PM Statement. All movie theatres, snooker rooms and video parlours should be closed.   Press Release from PM Archived: http://web.archive.org/web/20210330091444/https://kuenselonline.com/press-release-from-prime-ministers-office/

All movie theatres, snooker rooms and video parlours should be closed.   All business entities must adjust timing and engage employees in a way that there is no crowding.  All business entities must ensure and make it conducive for their customers maintain physical distance.  While open-air shows are disallowed, television programs must be modified for participants to observe physical distance.  Agencies will have to devise and institute “work from home” system.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210330091444/https://kuenselonline.com/press-release-from-prime-ministers-office/

Gatherings for religious purposes are discouraged, prompted by the fact that countries have experienced outbreaks from such events.     Gathering at any social events like birthday, wedding or promotion are disallowed.     Picnics or similar outdoor functions are prohibited.    All congregations at work, official dinners, functions or gatherings at workplace eateries are discouraged.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210330091444/https://kuenselonline.com/press-release-from-prime-ministers-office/

No change from the March 27 PM Statement. No games or sports that require physical contact like football and basketball are allowed.  Press Release from PM Archived: http://web.archive.org/web/20210330091444/https://kuenselonline.com/press-release-from-prime-ministers-office/

Gatherings for religious purposes are discouraged, prompted by the fact that countries have experienced outbreaks from such events.   Gathering at any social events like birthday, wedding or promotion are disallowed.   Picnics or similar outdoor functions are prohibited.  All congregations at work, official dinners, functions or gatherings at workplace eateries are discouraged.   Individuals are required to maintain physical distance from the rest at grocery outlets, vegetable markets, fuel depots or other public places.   While in queue to avail of services like banking or hospital, individuals are required to maintain physical distance.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210330091444/https://kuenselonline.com/press-release-from-prime-ministers-office/

Agencies will have to devise and institute “work from home” system.   Agencies are encouraged to use technology for meetings and correspondence of all kind.     In such emergencies, we have no doubt everyone has to shoulder immense workload. We are all expected to work beyond normal office hours. Here, we would like to state that as public servants, one should be guilt-ridden if you are not contributing or are not fully engaged in such times. Irrespective of where you are working from, you must come forward and make the most of your time.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210330091444/https://kuenselonline.com/press-release-from-prime-ministers-office/

Ministry of Home Affairs' order issued 27 Jan 2021 on ""Containment and Surveillance"" has been extended until 31 Mar 2021. States are allowed to enforce any restrictions over and above basic social distancing standards (eg 50% capacity on all indoor venues) required on religious halls, public gatherings, etc.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210404132810/https://www.mha.gov.in/sites/default/files/MHAorderdt_27012021.pdf

The federal government has issued a general recommendation to states to ""cancel or restrict public gatherings"" on March 22. With the progressive increase in cases, a number of states have imposed restrictions on gatherings for any religious, political or social event.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210412222641/https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/covid-19-impose-local-curbs-restrict-festival-gatherings-centre-tells-states/articleshow/81668985.cms  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412222830/https://www.thehindu.com/news/cities/Hyderabad/masks-restrictions-on-public-gatherings-mandatory-in-telangana/article34182055.ece

A,B,C: Covishield (by Serum Institute of India Ltd) and Covaxin (by Bharat Biotech International Ltd).  As of 1 March 2021, all those aged 60 and above, and those between 45 and 59 with comorbidities were offered the vaccine. Is a curfew in place? No.    Additionally, movement, business, and gathering restrictions are in force across high-risk areas; areas recently or currently designated as high-risk include parts of Ampara, Colombo, Gampaha, Kalutara, Kandy, Kurunegala, and Puttalam districts. Under curfew restrictions, all nonessential businesses except for specifically-permitted industries must close in designated areas. Essential shops, such as pharmacies and grocery stores, may open intermittently or provide delivery services.   Most businesses have resumed operations. Schools and universities have begun phased re-opening.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210412175517/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/454241/sri-lanka-government-maintaining-coronavirus-related-measures-as-of-march-12-update-42

https://web.archive.org/web/20210420125450/https://thehimalayantimes.com/nepal/health-ministry-recommends-closure-of-schools-owing-to-rapid-increase-in-covid-19-cases    KATHMANDU, APRIL 13Ministry of Health and Population has recommended the closure of schools for one month in larger cities of the country including Kathmandu valley.The recommendation has been made to the Covid-19 Crisis Management Centre (CCMC) owing to the rapidly increasing cases of coronavirus infection across the country. The health ministry has suggested that classes for students be continued through the online medium during this time.

https://web.archive.org/web/20210420125318/https://www.aninews.in/news/world/asia/nepal-to-close-all-schools-in-urban-areas-till-may-14-in-wake-of-rising-covid-19-cases20210419133107/    ""Kathmandu [Nepal], April 19 (ANI): An emergency ministerial meeting of Nepal Cabinet on Monday decided to close all the educational institutions of urban areas till May 14 in the wake of rising COVID-19 cases.  The information about the closure of schools in urban areas was shared by a sitting minister.  ""Meeting has decided to close the schools and colleges till end of Baisakh (May 14). Along with the educational institutions other services which brings on more people at one place also has been asked to close,"" Prabhu Shah, a sitting Minister in cabinet of Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli told ANI over phone.""

""Is a curfew in place? No.  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? Not currently, but restrictions remain possible in many locations.  Check local conditions before travelling.  Limited long-range public bus transportation is allowed to operate at 50% capacity and is subject to strict COVID mitigation measures.  The Kathmandu District Administration Office (DAO) as of April 5 has mandated that all travelers entering the district undergo an antigen test for COVID-19, with a positive antigen test result requiring a follow-on PCR test. ""  https://web.archive.org/web/20210419202615/https://np.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/    Note: i am coding C7 as a 1T  (Reviewers should verify/validate this code): while internal movement continues, in limited regions (like Katmandu valley) COVID tests are required, long distance travel is limited to 50% and local authorities do have the capability to lockdown movement if they deem necessary. As such, these factors suggest that at the very least, there are some recommended restrictions in some parts of the country w.r.t. internal movement.

Nepal, which has poor health infrastructure, says it has testing facilities for 23,000 samples, but on an average fewer than 15,000 tests are conducted daily.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210418203536/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-nepal/nepal-to-provide-free-covid-19-tests-and-treatment-as-cases-surge-idINKBN27Q0QA

https://web.archive.org/web/20210418203536if_/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-nepal/nepal-to-provide-free-covid-19-tests-and-treatment-as-cases-surge-idINKBN27Q0QA  Nov 9, 2021: ""KATHMANDU (Reuters) - Nepal will provide free COVID-19 tests and treatment, an aide to the prime minister said on Tuesday, as the total number of infections was set to cross the 200,000 mark. The move follows a Supreme Court order for free treatment last week after the Communist government asked citizens who could afford to pay to do so, limiting free testing and care to only those who couldn’t.  Surya Thapa, an aide to Prime Minister K.P. Sharma Oli, said all government hospitals would provide testing and treatment to COVID-19 patients for free.  “Those who want fast services and wish to pay can continue to go to private hospitals,” Thapa told Reuters.""    https://web.archive.org/web/20210419202615/https://np.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/    Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in Nepal? Yes. If so, are test results reliably available within 72 hours? Yes.

https://web.archive.org/web/20210422230211/https://np.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/  Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in Nepal? Yes. If so, are test results reliably available within 72 hours? Yes.

https://web.archive.org/web/20210418203536if_/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-nepal/nepal-to-provide-free-covid-19-tests-and-treatment-as-cases-surge-idINKBN27Q0QA    note: it is unclear if increased/free access to testing since March 9 2021 has actually improved contact tracing.   It is worth noting that the “Hamro Swasthya” application (https://web.archive.org/web/20210420124550/https://covid19.mohp.gov.np/) has supported some form of contact tracing since Aug 2020; but again it is unclear how effective such a solution has been in tracing the spread.
